results.title: Summer Squash + Zucchini Quinoa Salad with Toasted Pine Nuts

steps.step: In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the squash and in zucchini in the olive oil until almost tender, about 3 - 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add quinoa to the skillet and cook for another minute or so until everything is warm.

Whisk together the lemon juice, zest, dill and red pepper flakes in a small bowl.Either transfer this mixture to a bowl or leave in the skillet and add the dressing and pine nuts. Toss to combine, taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed.
Serve warm or cool in the fridge for 30 minutes.

results.title: Summer Squash + Zucchini Quinoa Salad with Toasted Pine Nuts

steps.step: In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the squash and in zucchini in the olive oil until almost tender, about 3 - 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add quinoa to the skillet and cook for another minute or so until everything is warm.

Whisk together the lemon juice, zest, dill and red pepper flakes in a small bowl.Either transfer this mixture to a bowl or leave in the skillet and add the dressing and pine nuts. Toss to combine, taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed.
Serve warm or cool in the fridge for 30 minutes.

extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups chopped carrots or about 5 medium carrots, peeled and chopped
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups chopped carrots or about 5 medium carrots, peeled and chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: chopped carrots or about 5 medium carrots, peeled and chopped

extendedIngredients.name: red lentils
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups red lentils, rinsed until water runs clear
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups red lentils, rinsed until water runs clear
extendedIngredients.originalName: red lentils, rinsed until water runs clear

steps.step: Heat 2 Tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saut the onion and garlic until soft, about 2 minutes then add the spices and continue to saut about 4 minutes.
Add the carrots and saut until carrots are tender, about 10-12 minutes.

Add the vegetable broth, diced tomatoes and lentils and stir to combine. Simmer on low heat for 20 minutes, or until lentils are tender.You can eat the soup as is with the chunks of carrots, lentils and tomatoes or you can use a handheld immersion blender or regular blender to create a creamy soup.
Serve the soup with fresh cilantro, crushed red pepper and fresh lemon juice.

results.title: Sauteed Swiss Chard with Lemon and Garlic

steps.step: Pre-heat a saute pan on medium high heat then add olive oil.
Saute chard in olive oil for 2-3 minutes until leaves turn bright green.
Add garlic and chili flakes and saute additional 30 seconds.
Remove from heat and toss with lemon juice just before serving.

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 1 T. of minced garlic (about 2-3 cloves, depending on size)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 T. of minced garlic (about 2-3 cloves, depending on size)
extendedIngredients.originalName: minced garlic (about 2-3 cloves, depending on size)

results.title: Real Men Cook: Sautéed Garlic Spinach

steps.step: Heat up a medium sized skillet to medium low heat.
Add 1 T. of olive and  tsp. of red pepper flakes.
Let the red pepper flakes infuse into the oil for about 1 minute, stirring entire time in skillet.
Add 1 T. of minced garlic, and saut for 30 seconds again stirring constantly.
Add 16 oz. of fresh spinach.
Mix the spinach, red pepper flakes, and garlic together and cover.
Let saut for 5-7 minutes, or until spinach is almost completely wilted.
Add salt & pepper to taste and stir to incorporate all ingredients completely. Viola!

extendedIngredients.name: swiss chard
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large bunch of Swiss chard, thoroughly rinsed, thick center stem removed, leaves cut into 1/2-inch wide ribbons
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large bunch of Swiss chard, thoroughly rinsed, thick center stem removed, leaves cut into 1/2-inch wide ribbons
extendedIngredients.originalName: Swiss chard, thoroughly rinsed, thick center stem removed, leaves cut into 1/2-inch wide ribbons

extendedIngredients.name: parsnip
extendedIngredients.original: 1 medium parsnip root, peeled to remove the outer skin, then completely peeled into ribbons using the vegetable peeler (except for center if tough)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium parsnip root, peeled to remove the outer skin, then completely peeled into ribbons using the vegetable peeler (except for center if tough)
extendedIngredients.originalName: parsnip root, peeled to remove the outer skin, then completely peeled into ribbons using the vegetable peeler (except for center if tough)

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.original: A drizzle of balsamic vinegar or lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: A drizzle of balsamic vinegar or lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalName: A drizzle of balsamic vinegar or lemon juice

steps.step: Heat olive oil in a large sauté pan on medium high heat.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Add the chard and ribbons of parsnip to the pan. Use tongs to turn over in the pan to coat with the olive oil and garlic. Keep turning until the chard begins to wilt.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lower the heat to low and cover the pan for a couple minutes.
Sprinkle with balsamic:
Drizzle with a little balsamic vinegar or lemon juice to serve.
